intro: Hieracium capnodes, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a tall, unbranched stem that bears numerous yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Hieracium capnodes is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes, making it a persistent weed in various habitats.
